question: Do RNA binding Proteins  that bind to adenine uridine (AU)-rich elements (AREs) in the 5' untranslated region (UTR) of mRNAs (AU-RBPs) regulate the DNA Damage Response?
ideal_answer: RNA Binding Proteins (RBPs) that bind to adenine uridine (AU)-rich elements (AREs) in the 3' untranslated region (UTR) of mRNAs (AU-RBPs) have emerged as key players in regulating the DNA Damage Response (DDR) and preserving genome integrity.
